newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan BSPA buys 108,000 tonnes soybeans at tender.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan BSPA buys 108,000 tonnes soybeans at tender.

text.p: The Kaohsiung division of Taiwan's Breakfast Soybean Procurement Association bought two 54,000-tonne shipments of South American soybeans at a tender on Tuesday, traders said.
Traders said Tuesday's bids were mostly for soybean supplies of South American origin, while a few that specified U.S. grain ranged between US$10 to US$22 per tonne higher.
Traders said the grain most likely would come from Brazil rather than Argentina, but noted that negotiations with suppliers were still under way.

Traders said the tender was likely to lure other Taiwan soy buyers into the market -- chiefly the unaffiliated and highly competitive Taichung division of the Breakfast Soybean Procurement Association.
The Kaohsiung division comprises Great Wall Enterprise, Ttet Union, President Enterprise and Tai Hwa Oil.
Details for the tender are as follows:
